page.title: 08HERTINGFORDBURY SCHOOL I
page.content: Hundreds of years ago people didn't bother to read or write,even the kings and queens couldn't read or write they just put a red mark on their documents. The only record of our school is an early date in the date of the first headmaster in the year of 1787 from early maps of the village for example the school is marked. The oldest part of the school is the hall,kitchen and upper infant's room were built in 1850.There are two ways we know this the first way is that Earl Cowper the man who built our school kept a book and always kept an account of the pay of the builders.They used to have a big fire in the hall.They also had oil lamp's for lighting.The Caretaker had to bring the coal and firewood himself they all worked in the hall.]]]]]]
